items.q: Fill in the blank: I gladly ___ your invitation.
Fill in the blank: Everyone ___ John passed the test.
Choose the sentence that uses 'accept' correctly.
options: She decided to accept the job.
Except my apology for the delay.
They were all except into the group.

items.q: Choose the sentence that uses 'except' correctly.
options: I accept the fact that I was wrong.
They will except the package tomorrow.
The store is open every day except Sunday.
She excepted the prize with a smile.

items.q: Identify the sentence with the error in 'accept' or 'except'.
options: I accept full responsibility for the mistake.
We work every day except Saturday and Sunday.
She was willing to except the consequences.
They refused to accept the new terms.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'They agreed to ___ all the conditions ___ one.'
Choose the best option: 'Please ___ my apology for not replying sooner.'
Which sentence uses both words correctly?
options: I will except the offer, except the low salary.
I will accept the offer, accept the low salary.
I will accept the offer, except the low salary.
I will except the offer, accept the low salary.

items.q: Fill in the blank: The museum is open daily ___ on public holidays.
Fill in the blank: She decided to ___ the fact that change takes time.
Choose the sentence that is completely correct.
options: He refused to except any gifts.
He refused to accept any gifts.
He refused to accept any gifts, except a small card which he bought himself.
He refused to except any gifts, accept a small card which he bought himself.

items.q: Identify the sentence with the mistake.
options: Everyone except the manager was present.
We accept that mistakes can happen.
Except for a few details, the report is complete.
They will except new members starting next month.

items.q: Which statement explains the difference between 'accept' and 'except'?
Fill in the blanks: 'They chose to ___ the proposal, ___ for one minor change.'
Choose the best completion: 'All of the students, ___ one, completed the assignment on time.'

options: She couldn't except that the plan had failed.
She couldn't accept that the plan had failed.
She couldn't accept that the plan had failed, accept for one detail.
She couldn't except that the plan had failed, except one detail.

items.q: Fill in the blank: 'The teacher will not ___ late submissions, ___ in emergencies.'
Choose the sentence that is completely correct.
options: We are happy to except any suggestions you may have.
We are happy to accept any suggestions you may have.
We are happy to accept any suggestions you may have, accept ones that are off-topic.
We are happy to except any suggestions you may have, except ones that are off-topic.

items.q: In the sentence 'Everyone except the new intern accepted the invitation', what role does 'except' play?
options: It is a verb meaning 'to agree to'.
It is a preposition showing exclusion.
